schema:name: Soil Chemistry Analysis - Great Basin Transect 2025
schema:description: Major and trace element analysis of soil samples collected along a 200 km transect across the Great Basin, using ICP-MS and XRF spectrometry with certified reference materials.
prov:used: Soil core samples collected June 2025, sites GB-001 through GB-045

prov:used.schema:name: EPA Method 6200 - XRF Analysis of Soils

schema:object: Dried and sieved soil samples (<2 mm fraction) from Great Basin transect

schema:location.schema:name: Nevada Bureau of Mines and Geology Analytical Lab
schema:location.schema:address: University of Nevada, Reno, 1664 N. Virginia Street, Reno, NV 89557

schema:actionProcess.schema:name: EPA 6200 / ICP-MS Soil Geochemistry Protocol
schema:actionProcess.schema:description: Combined XRF screening and ICP-MS confirmatory analysis for major and trace elements in soil matrices.

schema:step.schema:name: Sample preparation and acid digestion
schema:step.schema:description: Homogenize dried samples, split 0.5 g aliquots, digest with HNO3-HCl-HF mixture at 190 C in closed vessels.

schema:step.schema:name: ICP-MS measurement and calibration
schema:step.schema:description: Analyze digested solutions by ICP-MS using external calibration with NIST SRM 2710a and 2711a as quality control standards.
